briefdescription.para: default entry of CPU exceptions, such as TLB miss and swap.

detaileddescription.para: In default, all interrupt exceptions are installed with normal entry. If FIRQ is required, exc_entry_firq should be the entry.
< number of CPU exceptions number of interrupt exceptions, defined in arc_feature_config.h

briefdescription.para: the data type for exception entry
the data type for exception handler
the data type for interrupt handler
the counter for exc/int processing, =0 no int/exc >1 in int/exc processing

detaileddescription.para: install exception entry table to ARC_AUX_INT_VECT_BASE in startup. According to ARCv2 ISA, vectors are fetched in instruction space and thus may be present in ICCM, Instruction Cache, or main memory accessed by instruction fetch logic. So it is put into a specific section .vector.
Please note that the exc_entry_table maybe cached in ARC. Some functions is defined in .s files.

briefdescription.para: the cpu exception and interrupt exception handler table called in exc_entry_default and exc_entry_int
check whether the specific int is enabled
set interrupt secure or not secure
probe the pending status of interrupt
config the interrupt level triggered or pulse triggered
unlock cpu, enable interrupts to happen
unlock cpu with the specific status
initialize the exception and interrupt handling

parameterdescription.para: the entry of exception to install

briefdescription.para: get the installed CPU exception entry

parameterdescription.para: the handler of exception to install

simplesect.para: the installed exception handler or NULL
